rev.diff:
Line 40: Line 40:
Microsoft first announced IE 9 at PDC 2009 and spoke mainly about how it takes advantage of hardware acceleration in [[DirectX]] to improve the performance of [[web applications]] and improve the quality of [[web typography]].
Microsoft first announced IE 9 at PDC 2009 and spoke mainly about how it takes advantage of hardware acceleration in [[DirectX]] to improve the performance of [[web applications]] and improve the quality of [[web typography]].
â
Later, Microsoft announced that they had joined the W3C's SVG Working Group, which sparked speculation that IE 9 will support SVG. This was proven to be true at MIX10, where they demonstrated support for basic SVG markup and improved support for HTML5. They also announced that they will increase the support greatly by the time the first IE 9 beta is released. The IE team has also introduced the new JavaScript engine, codenamed Chakra, which compiles code to native code.<ref>http://news.softpedia.com/news/Internet-Explorer-9-Beta-Next-New-IE9-Builds-Every-8-Weeks-138013.shtml</ref>
+
Later, Microsoft announced that they had joined the [[W3C]]'s SVG Working Group, which sparked speculation that IE 9 will support SVG. This was proven to be true at MIX10, where they demonstrated support for basic SVG markup and improved support for HTML5. They also announced that they will increase the support greatly by the time the first IE 9 beta is released. The IE team has also introduced the new JavaScript engine, codenamed Chakra, which compiles code to native code.<ref>http://news.softpedia.com/news/Internet-Explorer-9-Beta-Next-New-IE9-Builds-Every-8-Weeks-138013.shtml</ref>
While at MIX10, a platform preview was released. It was not a full build of IE, as it was for testing the latest version of the [[Trident (layout engine)|Trident]] layout engine. It contained a minimalistic user interface. It is for web developers to send feedback on the improvements made. Microsoft say that it will be updated approximately every eight weeks.
While at MIX10, a platform preview was released. It was not a full build of IE, as it was for testing the latest version of the [[Trident (layout engine)|Trident]] layout engine. It contained a minimalistic user interface. It is for web developers to send feedback on the improvements made. Microsoft say that it will be updated approximately every eight weeks.
